publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2809 Christine Grahame: Sport for Disabled People in the Scottish Borders and the Waterside Fitness Club, Jedburgh-That the Parliament congratulates the representatives from the Scottish Borders who will be taking part in the World Special Olympics in Dublin in 2003, namely badminton players Ronald Young, Graeme Lang and Steven George, swimmer Alan German, Gordon Yule the UK badminton coach and Jed Renilson the Assistant Head of Delegation; notes with concern that Jedburgh swimming pool is currently under threat of closure due to the £5.9 million cuts by Scottish Borders Council's administration at a time when athletes from all over the Borders attend the pool for Special Olympics Regional Squad sessions on a weekly basis and that the pool is essential not only for those athletes, but the entire community, with swimming lessons taking place Monday to Saturday with 16 classes and 10 pupils to a class, disabled lessons with 1 to 1 tuition and waiting lists for all swimming lessons, parent and baby classes, fun sessions for children and crash swimming courses; further notes that the pool is used by over 600 pupils per week from the primary schools Parkside, Howdenburn, Hobkirk, Keilder/Bryness, Glendouglas, Jedburgh Grammar, Earlston High and Howdenburn School House Special Needs with disabled dippers' groups, community education group canoeing, Jedburgh Rugby Football Club and Women's Borders Aid also as user groups, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to ensure that this essential community facility does not close.
